alert.note: Alert for Carroll (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 31 at 11:19PM CDT until June 02 at 11:35PM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Missouri... Wakenda Creek at Carrollton affecting Carroll County. This product along with additional weather and stream information is available at www.weather.gov/kc/. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wakenda Creek at Carrollton. * WHEN...Until late Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Flooding of low-lying undeveloped areas along the creek begins. At 19.1 feet, Water reaches the bottom of the South Main Street bridge over Wakenda Creek. At 19.8 feet, South Main Street along with Stonewall Street and Wabash Road on the south side of Carrollton are overtopped by flood waters. Flood waters also threaten businesses in low-lying areas near the creek. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 15.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 17.9 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Obs Forecasts Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Wed Thu 1am 1pm 1am Wakenda Creek Carrollton 16.0 15.3 Tue 11pm 15.8 17.9 15.6 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
